alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON... SOUTHEASTERN MEADE...NORTHEASTERN HARDIN AND BULLITT COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Brandenburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shepherdsville, Pioneer Village, Radcliff, Mount Washington, Lebanon Junction, Hebron Estates, Muldraugh, West Point, Fox Chase and Bardstown Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
